text:
26. Approximately 95% of all observations for a normally distributed random
variable fall in the interval:
A. p: 0.
B. p + 20.
C. pt 30.
The probability that a normally distributed random variable will be more than
two standard deviations above its mean is:
A. 0.0228.
B. 0.4772.
C. 0.9772.
28.
A stock doubled in value last year. Its continuously compounded return over the
period was closest to:
A. 18.2%.
B. 69.3%.
C. 100.0%.
29.
Portfolio A has a safety-first ratio of 1.3 with a threshold return of 2%. What is
the shortfall risk for a threshold return of 2%?
A. 9.68%.
B. 40.30%.
C. 90.30%.
For more questions related to this topic review, log in to your Schweser online account and
launch SchweserPro TM QBank; and for video instruction covering each LOS in this topic
review, log in to your Schweser online account and launch the OnDemand video lectures, if
you have purchased these products.
